text: Hey guys I'm working with this module and can't seem to figure out the rows are not lining up, but when I isolate the module by itself it works perfectly fine with out the themes css file. Any idea what the issue might be? I tried everything in the book, but it seems to be a css or conflict with the module and the theme we are using.

So I have this in a module for my blog listing page, however it seems that any tags that are more than one word canâ€™t be pulled. Any suggestions on how to overcome this?
```{% set posts = blog_recent_tag_posts('default',module.tag_field, 5) %}```

Hi Ziad did you build this yourself? There is a height being applied to the other rows that isn't being applied to the first column "height: 69px" If I apply that to ".comparison-card-item" then it seems to align correctly.
No I didn't build this module got it from the marketplace
Reached out to the dev and no response so I am trying to fix it myself
OK I removed that buggy little java code and just edited the height of the parent column and it works like a charm! Thank you so much!!!
Good job Ziad glad I could help.
Would pass this to the dev team to see if you can get some feed back.
